item.title: [Python] What I've done to welcome the Python 2 EOL with confidence
item.description: ## Self-introduction I am @yukin01 who is an SRE on the SRE/QA team. I used to use iOS and Firebase/GCP to develop applications until half a year ago, but now that I want to strengthen the infrastructure, I am using AWS and GCP as an SRE at GLOBIS. Python2 EOL As you know, Python2 is announced to end support on January 1, 2020, but if you have any products or tools that are still dependent on Python2, you’ll want to get rid of them by EOL.

item.title: [Python] Ansible infrastructure automation tool for those who are not good at Ruby
item.description: ## Introduction I think I can start learning Ruby with Ruby, but I think it would be nice to be able to write the same thing in python. Nowadays, in the shadow of chef, which is famous as an infrastructure automation tool, automation tools using python I heard it was there and tried using it immediately. Here we will introduce the procedure to start a remote environment with vagrant and set up the remote machine with ansible.
